results.title: For the love of...Lolo
results.creator_credit: Ayen Guinto, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Ayen Guinto lost her beloved ‘Lolo’, her family lost the glue holding them together. She remembers him and wonders if the family should use his life as inspiration to move forward.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ayen Guinto, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Ayen Guinto lost her beloved ‘Lolo’, her family lost the glue holding them together. She remembers him and wonders if the family should use his life as inspiration to move forward.
description_for_label: When Ayen Guinto lost her beloved ‘Lolo’, her family lost the glue holding them together. She remembers him and wonders if the family should use his life as inspiration to move forward.

results.title: Bittersweet
results.creator_credit: Maria Savarino, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When the train from Beijing to Lhasa started running again, Maria Savarino and her husband took the opportunity to visit Tibet before it had changed forever. What they found there was a bittersweet experience they will never forget but also never revisit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maria Savarino, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When the train from Beijing to Lhasa started running again, Maria Savarino and her husband took the opportunity to visit Tibet before it had changed forever. What they found there was a bittersweet experience they will never forget but also never revisit.

results.title: My little angel
results.creator_credit: Chris Mansfield, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Chris Mansfield introduces his daughter to the family she is about to be born into. A big family with a diverse Indigenous history, Mansfield is looking forward to his new responsibility.

results.title: Always thinking of home
results.creator_credit: Troy Lovett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Troy Lovett’s parents divorced, he moved to Heywood which had a great Koorie population and was a great place to grow up. Lovett has since moved to Shepparton and, while he doesn’t miss the small town itself, there is a lot he misses about it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Troy Lovett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Troy Lovett’s parents divorced, he moved to Heywood which had a great Koorie population and was a great place to grow up. Lovett has since moved to Shepparton and, while he doesn’t miss the small town itself, there is a lot he misses about it.
